title: yotsuyu_goe_brutus
body:
A sadistic [[Hyur]]an woman serving as one of the main antagonists in [[Final Fantasy XIV]]'s [i]Stormblood[/i] expansion. 

She has [[green eyes]], [[long hair|long]], [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. Her attire consists of an [[off shoulder]] [[black kimono]], [[yellow sash|yellow]] [[obi]] complete with an [[obijime]] and visible [[obiage]], and [[okobo]] sandals. Her hair is adorned with a [[epiphyllum|"queen of the night"]] [[hair flower|flower]] and [[bat hair ornament|bat-shaped sticks]]. She also wears a [[black collar|black]] [[lace collar]] around her neck. Usually seen holding a [[kiseru]].

Drawing on her storyline, Yotsuyu's character is often symbolized by the [[full moon]] and [[spider lily]] flower in fanart. [spoilers]A notable element of this is her transformation into the lunar primal [[Tsukuyomi (ff14)|Tsukuyomi]].[/spoiler]

h4. Official art

title: doki_doki_majo_shinpan
body:
Doki Doki Majo Shinpan! (どきどき魔女神判!, lit. "Thump-Thump Witch Judgement", or more accurately translated as "Heart-Pounding Magical Investigation") is a game developed by [[SNK]] Playmore for [[Nintendo DS]].

The player assumes the role of a junior high school student who is asked by an angel to locate a [[witch]] that has sneaked into her school. In order to find the witch, she must search the suspects' bodies for a "witch mark." The preferred method is by using touch (using the stylus to guide her hands).

A sequel titled Doki Doki Majo Shinpan 2 Duo was released 31 July 2008, and a third game titled Doki Majo Plus was released on July 30, 2009.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Doki Doki Majo Shinpan!":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doki_Doki_Majo_Shinpan!

title: soldering
body:
The act of joining two [[metal]]lic surfaces together by [[melting]] a metal or alloy (referred to as solder) with a lower melting point into the space between them. This can be done by heating both the solder and the surfaces using a [[soldering iron]], a heat gun, or a [[fire|flame]]. Differs from [[welding]] in that the metals to be joined are themselves not heated all the way to melting point.

When higher melting point solder is used, it is referred to as "brazing".

title: scheherazade_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] One Thousand and One Nights, a collection of Middle Eastern folk tales compiled in Arabic during the Islamic Golden Age. The work was collected over many centuries by various authors, translators, and scholars across West, Central and South Asia, and North Africa, so there's no definitive version. What is common to all the versions of the Nights is the initial frame story of the ruler Shahryār and his wife Scheherazade and the framing device incorporated throughout the tales themselves.
[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Iguchi Yuka]].

title: tripod_(mecha)
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[walker (robot)|]] mecha from the novel "The [[War of the Worlds]]" published in 1898.

It is a giant three legged [[robot]] piloted by a Martian and armed with a devastating energy cannon (the "heat ray") and several mechanical tentacles. This machine is perhaps the first example of an alien [[mecha]] in the [[science fiction]] genre.

The [[Big Zam]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] was inspired by this walker.

title: kusanagi_(clone)
body:
One of the characters from [[The King of Fighters]] series of fighting games developed by [[SNK]]. He is voiced by [[Iwata Mitsuo]].

He was believed by many fans to have been originally created as a NESTS experiment, mainly a clone of [[Kusanagi Kyou]], due to a special intro he has with [[K9999]]. This introduction is, in fact, an homage to [[AKIRA (manga)|]] as both K9999 and Kusanagi have the same voice actors as [[Shima Tetsuo|Tetsuo]] and [[Kaneda Shoutarou (akira)|Kaneda]] respectively.

His actual backstory in [[the King of Fighters 2003|KOF 2003]] reveals him to be a product of [[Kagura Chizuru]]'s magic, used to test the strength of the tournament's contestants. His evil appearance is possibly due to the fact that he was created by Chizuru while under the control of [[Mukai (KoF)|]] (the leader of the KOF 2003 operation) and [[Botan (kof)|]] (the puppeteer controlling Chizuru).

title: kusanagi_kyou
body:
草薙 京 (くさなぎ きょう)

One of the main characters in [[SNK|SNK's]] [[The King of Fighters|King of Fighters]] video game series, Kusanagi Kyou was first introduced in [[The King of Fighters '94]] as the leader of the Japan team. He is the rival of [[Yagami Iori]] and the boyfriend of [[Kushinada Yuki|Yuki]].

He was first introduced as a cocky delinquent high school student who is the heir of his clan, Kusanagi, one of the three clans that sealed the legendary snake entity, [[Orochi (KOF)|Orochi]], 1,800 years ago. His clan wields pyrokinetic powers, an inherited power that few members obtain. They, along with the [[Yagami Iori|Yasakani]] and [[Kagura Chizuru|Yata]] clans, keep one of the three sacred treasures used to contain Orochi long ago. His family's treasure is the Kusanagi-no-Tsurugi and his family crest is the sun, represented in a stylized halo of fire. His official nickname is [b]Scion of the Flame[/b].

Some fans always remember Kyo as an eternal school boy, just like when [[Kagura Chizuru|Chizuru]] remembered him as one. This leads to the creation of [[KUSANAGI (Clone)|KUSANAGI]] in [[The King of Fighters 2003|KOF 2003]], and the 2 Kyo clones [[Kyo-1]] and [[Kyo-2]] in [[The King of Fighters '99|KOF '99]].

title: weimao
body:
A traditional [[chinese clothes|Chinese]] [[veil]]ed [[hat]]. Predecessor of the Japanese [[ichimegasa]].

Traditionally, it tends to reach shoulder-length only. If the veil is any shorter, it may be a hakka hat instead.

It originates from the more conservative [i]mili[/i], of which would cover a majority of the woman's body. ("image example":[https://www.newhanfu.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/introduce-of-hanfu-face-veil-mili-weimao-2.jpg])

And though the mili was traditionally worn by women, it was also worn by some men in the country of Tuyuhun (now Northwest China), as protection against strong sunlight.

The weimao is different from the humao, which is a [[balaclava]] worn beneath the hat, and was worn by both men and women on horseback.

h4. See also

* [[Honggaitou]] (Chinese red face veil)
* [[futou]]

title: sagitta_(constellation)
body:
Sagitta (the [[Arrow (projectile)|]]) is a small [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is the third smallest constellation in the sky. The constellation symbolizes an arrow shot by [[Hercules (constellation)|Heracles]] to kill the eagle of Zeus that was sent to gnaw the liver of Prometheus. Its brightest star is [i]Gamma Sagittae[/i].

Sagitta is an easily recognizable constellation. It consists of four connected stars that form the regular letter Y, as opposed to [[Cancer_(constellation)|]], which forms the irregular letter. Since the constellation symbolizes an arrow meant to kill the eagle, it is located right next to the constellation of [[Aquila (constellation)|]].

Not to be confused with [[Sagittarius_(constellation)|]] (the Archer).

h4. Examples

* !asset #21316879
* !post #5491298: Right constellation above the eagle

h4. Neighboring constellations

* [[Aquila (constellation)|]]
* [[Delphinus (constellation)|]]
* [[Hercules (constellation)|]]
* [[Vulpecula (constellation)|]]

h4. External links

* "eSky: Sagitta":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/sagitta.html

title: gundula_rall
body:
[[Strike Witches]] character.

Gundula Rall is a veteran witch of the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]], originating from [[Karlsland]]. Behind [[Gertrud Barkhorn|Barkhorn]] and [[Erica Hartmann|Hartmann]], she is Karlsland Airforce's (and, therefore humanity's) 3rd greatest ace. Her familiar is the [[wolf]].

Strong and confident, Rall takes to her role as commander with relish, acting as more of a brash, frankly-spoken older sister than the more motherly nagging of [[Aleksandra I. Pokryshkin|Pokryshkin]] and nurturing of [[Shimohara Sadako|Shimohara]]. Unlike many in her position, however, she doesn't let herself get too serious, and is laid back and good-humored on a personal level.

Her Ace Archetype is Günther Rall. Like Gundula, he was [[World War II]]'s third highest-scoring ace. 

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Günther Rall":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%BCnther_Rall

title: sanya_v._litvyak
body:
[[Strike Witches]] character.

Aleksandra "Sanya" Vladimirovna Litvyak is a Night Witch of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]], originating from Orussia and affiliated with her home unit: the Imperial Army of Orussia’s 586th Fighter regiment. Her familiar is the domestic cat. Her mild personality and nocturnal lifestyle give her a "ghost like" impression. 

Her Magic Antenna (魔導針, Madō Shin, lit. "Magic Needles") allow her to interact with radio waves. It is a type of non-visual perception that can detect objects at extreme ranges. Also can use a spell to provide guidance cues to other witches and aircraft and is able to tune in and rebroadcast radio transmissions.

Sanya based on Russian flying ace Lydia V. Litvyak, one of only two female aces of [[World War II]] and the only female pilot out of the pilots the witches are based on. Both share the name "White Lily of Stalingrad"; a nickname that may have been influential on the color choice of Sanya's hair. 

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Lydia V. Litvyak":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lydia_Litvyak
other_names: サーニャ・V・リトヴャク

title: gugure!_kokkuri-san
body:
Manga series by "Endou Midori":[https://twitter.com/midoroendo]. Its anime adaptation started airing in Fall 2014. Its abbreviated name is Gugukoku.

Ichimatsu Kohina is an elementary school girl who proclaims herself a living doll, explaining her lack of outward emotions.  She lives alone and has no friends, so when she plays [[Kokkuri-san (game)|]] (a spirit-summoning game like an [[ouija]] board) and invites Kokkuri-san to haunt her, an actual fox-eared person arrives and is shocked by her lifestyle.  Kokkuri-san winds up "haunting" her out of pity and concern to get her to stop living a life of avoiding people and eating nothing but cup noodles.

title: hercules_(constellation)
body:
Hercules is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. Its name is the Latin form of the Greek mythological hero Heracles. Its brightest star is Kornephoros.

Hercules has three most common shapes. The first resembles a [[flexing]] stick figure, appearing upside down relative to the neighboring constellations. The second resembles a stick figure with a club raised above its head. The third is a quadrilateral, called the "[i]"Keystone":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/keystone.html[/i]" asterism, with four bent limbs.

h4. Examples

title: dogwood_(flower)
body:
[i][b]Cornus[/b][/i], commonly known as dogwood, is a genus of about 30–60 species of woody plants in the family [i]Cornaceae[/i].

Dogwood represents a four-petaled flower with a characteristic center, but just like the [[poinsettia]], the four petals are bracts (specialized leaves) that surround the actual inconspicuous flowers in the center. 

Two of the most commonly depicted species are [i]Cornus florida (hanamizuki)[/i] and [i]Cornus kousa (yamaboushi)[/i]. The former has rounded, notched bract "petals" while the latter has pointed ones.

title: sandersonia_(flower)
body:
A flower genus native to South Africa. The sole member of the genus is called [i]Sandersonia aurantiaca[/i].

Sandersonia has [[yellow flower|yellow]] to [[orange flower|orange]] bell- or lantern-shaped flowers that hang from a central stem with thin, lance-shaped leaves. Because of its resemblance to [[lily of the valley]], it is commonly known as [b]golden lily of the valley[/b]. Other common names include [b]Chinese lantern lily[/b] and [b]Christmas bells[/b].

title: epiphyllum
body:
A genus of flowering [[cactus|cacti]]. Its [[flower]]s are famous for blooming at night instead of during the day. Some species, such as [i]Epiphyllum oxypetalum[/i], bloom for only one night and wilt in the morning. Nowadays there are also day-blooming hybrids.

Epiphyllum represents a layered flower with thin, long outer petals and thicker, shorter inner petals. Common epiphyllums are white, but hybrids can also be orange, pink, red and yellow. Common names include [b]climbing cactus[/b], [b]Dutchman's pipe cactus[/b], [b][[orchid]]  cactus[/b] and [b]queen of the night[/b].

Its Japanese name 月下美人 [i](gekka-bijin)[/i] literally translates to "beauty under the moon". The one-night bloom of [i]Epiphyllum oxypetalum[/i] is often used as a metaphor for the transience of beauty.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21164593
* !post #1273907
* !post #1674604
* !post #2629389

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Epiphyllum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epiphyllum

* "Wikipedia: Epiphyllum hybrid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epiphyllum_hybrid
* "Wikipedia: Cactaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cactus

title: rose_of_sharon
body:
[i]Hibiscus syriacus[/i] is a species of [[hibiscus]] in the [i]Malvaceae[/i] family. Other names include [b]Syrian ketmia[/b], [b]shurb althea[/b], [b]rose mallow[/b], [b]mugunghwa[/b] or [b]mokkeunhwa[/b]. It is the national flower of [[South Korea]].

Rose of Sharon bears trumpet- or vase-shaped flowers with five broad petals and a distinctive long pistil. Unlike [i]Hibiscus rosa-sinensis[/i], the stamens of [i]Hibiscus syriacus[/i] surround the pistil from base to tip. Flowers come in shades of pink, red, blue, purple and white. They are often bicolored, with the base of the petals having a different color.

h4. Examples

* "Wikipedia: Malvaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malvaceae

title: big_dipper
body:
An asterism (a group of bright [[star (sky)|]]s forming a pattern) consisting of seven bright stars of the [[constellation]] [[Ursa Major (constellation)|]], recognized by its shape, which resembles a ladle or pot with a handle, hence the name. Also called the [i]Plough[/i] and in China and Japan the [i]North Dipper[/i] (北斗), which contrasts with the traditional Chinese constellation called the "[i]South Dipper[/i]":https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Sagittarius_with_Chinese_Asterisms_and_Mansions.svg (南斗), a six-star part of the [[Sagittarius_(constellation)|]] constellation. It is also referred to simply as the "North Star" in several countries.

The Big Dipper can be distinguished from [[Ursa Minor (constellation)|]], also known as the [i]Little Dipper[/i], by its "handle": the former is bent downward, while the latter is bent upward.

h4. Examples

* !post #530127

title: lupus_(constellation)
body:
Lupus (the [[Wolf]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest star is Kakkab, also known as Men.

Lupus represents a stick figure of an animal with a triangular head and no tail, as opposed to [[Canis Major (constellation)|]], which has a tail. The constellation lies directly to the left of [[Centaurus (constellation)|]] and is often interpreted as an animal that has been killed or is about to be killed.

Not to be confused with [[Lepus_(constellation)|]] (the Hare).

title: canis_major_(constellation)
body:
Canis Major (the Greater [[Dog]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its name, the [i]Greater Dog[/i], refers to and contrasts it with nearby [[Canis Minor (constellation)|]], the [i]Lesser Dog[/i]. Its brightest star is [[Sirius (star)|]], part of the "Winter Triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Triangle and the brightest star in the sky other than the [[Sun]].

Canis Major represents a stick figure of an animal with a long, slender body and a triangular head. It has somewhat similar features to [[Lupus (constellation)|]], but can be distinguished by its "tail": Canis Major has it, while Lupus doesn't.

title: ophiuchus_(constellation)
body:
Ophiuchus (the Serpent Bearer or Snake Holder) is a [[constellation]] located on the celestial equator. It is also the thirteenth constellation that crosses the ecliptic, like the twelve constellations of the [[zodiac]]. Because of this, Ophiuchus is sometimes referred to as the [[Ophiuchus (zodiac)|thirteenth sign]] of the zodiac. It is "wedged" between [[Scorpius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]] to the east. The constellation is often associated with Asclepius in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is Rasalhague.

Ophiuchus the Serpent Bearer is virtually inseparable from [[Serpens (constellation)|]] the Serpent, so it is rarely depicted as a stand-alone constellation. It represents a stick figure with a large body holding a snake, represented by lines extending for both sides. Therefore, the snake itself is divided into two parts: Serpens Caput (head) to the west and Serpens Cauda (tail) to the east. The east and west of the celestial sphere are mirrored because the sphere is observed from the inside.

title: serpens_(constellation)
body:
Serpens (the Serpent or [[Snake]]) is a [[constellation]] located on the celestial equator. It is the only official constellation that is divided into two parts: Serpens Cauda (the Serpent's Tail) and Serpens Caput (the Serpent's Head). Its brightest star is Unukalhai, located in Serpens Caput.

Serpens the Serpent is virtually inseparable from [[Ophiuchus (constellation)|]] the Serpent Bearer, so it is rarely depicted as a stand-alone constellation, although Serpens Caput is sometimes depicted separately. It is represented by the two groups of straight lines extending from either side of Ophiuchus. The eastern part (to the left) is Serpens Cauda, represented by straight lines only, and the western part (to the right) is Serpens Caput, represented by several straight lines ending in a triangle. The east and west of the celestial sphere are mirrored because the sphere is observed from the inside.

title: capricorn_(constellation)
body:
Capricornus (the Horned [[Goat]]) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Aquarius (constellation)|]] to the east. Although "Capricornus" means the "horned goat" or "goat horn", it symbolizes a mythological sea goat that is half goat, half fish. It is the smallest constellation of the zodiac. Its brightest star is Deneb Algedi.

Capricornus resembles an arrowhead or a pointed letter D.

title: kamchatka_lily
body:
A species of [[flower]]ing plant of the genus [i]Fritillaria[/i] in the family [i]Liliaceae[/i], native to northeastern Asia and northwestern North America. Common names include [b]Black lily[/b], [b]Chocolate lily[/b], [b]Kamchatka lily[/b], and [b]Rice lily[/b].

Kamchatka lilies bear nodding, bell-shaped flowers that somewhat resemble tulips. The flowers are six-petaled and colored in shades of purple, reddish brown, or black, occasionally spotted or streaked. One of the distinctive features of the Kamchatka lily is its green pistil, which is divided into three sections, each with a relatively long tip. This feature helps to distinguish Kamchatka lilies from [[lily (flower)|true lilies]] and [[tulip]]s. The leaves are lance-shaped.

Note that its Japanese name, クロユリ (黒百合 [i]kuro-yuri[/i], lit. black lily), can be used for both fritillarias and black colored [[lily (flower)|lilies]] (genus Lilium). Pay attention to the flower details.

h4. Examples

title: lily_(flower)
body:
A [[flower]] of the genus [i]Lilium[/i] in the family [i]Liliaceae[/i].

Lily flowers have 6 petals (technically 3 petals and 3 sepals) and come in a variety of shapes such as bell, flat, funnel, recurved, trumpet, etc. They can be almost any color, but [[white lily|white lilies]] are probably the most well-known kind, being either [i]Lilium candidum[/i] (Madonna Lilies) or [i]Lilium longiflorum[/i] (Easter Lily) with their characteristic trumpet shape.

Lilies are a symbol for Girls Love as well as an eponym for its alternate name [[yuri]] due to their Japanese name "yuri".

h4. Examples 

* !post #1323515: [i]Lilium candidum[/i] 
* !post #1333457: [i]Lilium longiflorum[/i]

title: false_smile
body:
When a character is smiling on the outside, but their actions, situation or dialogue imply that they are anything but happy. This usually occurs during moments of shock, the bitter tension between enemies, or the proverbial calm before the storm just before they snap.

This tag is not for hysterical laughter, [[evil grin]]s, angry [[glaring|glares]], or [[yandere]].

h4. See also

title: kariginu
body:
A type of [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]].

A notable feature are the sleeves: they are not sewn to the body of the clothing, giving a distinct [[shoulder cutout|open slit on the shoulders]].

Originally designed as hunting clothes, they were comfortable enough that they became common informal clothing for the nobility during the Heian period and onwards.

Please note that this tag does not distinguish between actual kariginu, suikan and other similar clothes, encompassing all of them.

h4. Examples

* !post #7323281
* !post #7549467

h4.  Notable characters 

* [[Mononobe no Futo]] from [[Touhou]] 
* [[ryuujou (kancolle)|Ryuujou]] from [[Kantai Collection]]

h4.  See also

* [[Japanese clothes]]
* [[Tate eboshi]], a tall cap often worn with a kariginu by nobles.

h4.  External links

* "Kariginu sewing pattern":http://yousai.net/nui/tomomasa/karigunu1.htm
* "Historical Japanese men's outfits":https://sengokudaimyo.com/garb/mens-garments

title: takenouchi_sora
body:
One of the main characters from the anime [[Digimon Adventure]] and [[Digimon Adventure tri.]], and one of the supporting characters in [[Digimon Adventure 02]].

Sora is partnered with [[Piyomon]] and is the bearer of the Crest of Love.

When she was a child, she was very tomboyish, being the only girl in the school's soccer team, where she was the teammate of [[Yagami Taichi]] and [[Izumi Koshiro]]. A caring person, she was very protective of the group, and acted almost as a motherly figure, especially to [[Tachikawa Mimi]] and [[Takaishi Takeru]]. She often acted as a voice of reason to the others, especially during Taichi and Ishida Yamato's arguments.

h4. Appearance

* !post #732868: [[Digimon Adventure]]

title: gensokyo
body:
Gensokyo (幻想郷 [i]Gensoukyou[/i], lit. "Land of Illusions" or "Land of Fantasy") is the setting of [[Touhou]]. Its culture vaguely resembles that of feudal Japan, heavily embellished with folkloric elements. 

This tag is typically used for maps of the Touhou world or large landscape pictures.

h4. [[In-Universe Location]]s

* [[Misty Lake]]
* [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]

** Tsuyokiss ~Mighty Heart~ (2006 Playstation 2 port by PrincessSoft)
* Minikiss ~Tsuyokiss Fan Disk~ (2008 by Candy Soft, partially illustrated by [[Yoshino Keiko]])
* Tsuyokiss Nigakki ("Tsuyokiss: The Second Term", 2008 PC eroge by Candy Soft, illustrated by [[Mahiro Takeumi]])
** Tsuyokiss Nigakki -Swift Love- (2009 Playstation 2 port by NetRevo)

title: choko
body:
A virtual singer who has lent her vocals to numerous rhythm game songs, including [[Sound Voltex]] and [[Maimai (game)|]], as well as producing her own albums.

She is a young girl with dark [[brown hair]] (often depicted with a pink shade) styled in neck-length [[twintails]], and [[pink eyes]]. In her default design, which her 3D model uses, she is clothed in a [[black shirt]], a [[black choker]] with a [[heart]] decoration, a [[pink jacket]], [[pink leg warmers]] and [[pink footwear]].

title: v-shaped_eyes
body:
For when the top part of the eyes form a downward sloping v-shape.  Often used in comical situations to denote a funny type of evil or scary.

Not to be confused with eyes closed in an upward, downward or sideways manner, which are the [[^_^]], [[u_u]] and [[>_<]] tags respectively.

* [[tsurime]]

title: baund_doc
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV series from 1985.

[b]NRX-055 Baund Doc[/b]

A transformable, psycommu equipped [[mobile suit]] first deployed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. Ironically referred to as "the most beautiful and elegant of all MSs" in the first episode of [[Gundam ZZ]] (1986), despite its distorted, asymmetrical and outright ugly appearance when in MS mode. 

Multiple units were handed out to exceptionally skilled Newtype and Cyber-Newtype pilots, including [[Jerid Messa]], [[Gates Capa]] and [[Rosamia Badam]].

title: nsync
body:
[b]NSYNC[/b] (stylized as [b]*NSYNC[/b]) is an American Boy band composed of Justin Timberlake, JC Chasez, Chris Kirkpatrick, Joey Fatone, and Lance Bass, that began in 1995. Along with the [[Backstreet Boys]], NSYNC were part of a wave of teenage Boy Bands during the late 1990s and early 2000s.

The group has several hit songs including "Girlfriend", "Pop", "Bye Bye Bye", "Gone", and "It's Gonna Be Me". NSYNC disbanded in 2002 with Justin Timberlake going on to have a successful solo career. The group later have a reunion in 2023 when the band peform during the 2023 [[MTV]] Music Awards.

title: shinonome_yahiro
body:
Shinonome Yahiro (死乃々目 八尋) is a Taimanin from [[Taimanin RPGX]]. Designed by [[Zol]]
She almost died drowning, though she survived, she is now effected by her own Ninja Art and is stuck near the sea.
Because of her appearance, physique, and the presence of an evil spirit possessing her, few people would want to get close to her, and she also has few friends and acquaintances because she doesn't want to cause trouble to others with her constitution. Regardless, she wishes to be close to others at times, which can allow her powers to go slightly out of control. However, this is due to her kindness and dedication to her friends, and once you get to know her, she treats you as a quiet but very kind and gentle senior.

h4.External links
* "Taimanin Wiki: Shinonome Yahiro":https://taimanin.fandom.com/wiki/Shinonome_Yahiro
* "Sketches":https://x.com/NaniwaComteg/status/1821149468055543883

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[green hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She is generally seen with [[hair between eyes]] and a [[hair flower]].

title: beta_(inazuma_eleven)
body:
A character in [[Inazuma Eleven GO Chrono Stone]]. Voiced by [[Ise Mariya]].

Beta has [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]], [[purple eyes]] with [[no pupils]], and typically wears the Protocol Omega uniform with the captain's [[armband]]. Her eye color changes slightly depending on her mood.

Beta is the second captain of [[Protocol Omega]] (she replaced [[alpha (inazuma eleven)|Alpha]] and was replaced herself by [[gamma (inazuma eleven)|Gamma]]). She also appears in [[Inazuma Eleven Choujigen Dream Match]] as a member of [[Battle Eleven]].

Her [[keshin (inazuma eleven)|keshin]] is [[Kokuu no Megami Athena]]. The [[keshin armed|armed]] form is tagged [[kokuu no megami athena (armed)]].

h4. External links

* "Inazuma Eleven Wiki: Beta":http://inazuma-eleven.fandom.com/wiki/Beta

title: fudou_akio
body:
A character in [[Inazuma Eleven]] and [[Inazuma Eleven GO]]. Voiced by [[Kaji Yuuki]].

He has been a member of [[Shin Teikoku]], [[Inazuma Japan]], [[Inazuma Legend Japan]] (in [[go vs danball senki w|GO vs Danball Senki W]]), and [[Battle Eleven]] (in [[inazuma eleven choujigen dream match|Choujigen Dream Match]]). He was also the coach of [[Resistance Japan]] in [[inazuma eleven go galaxy|GO Galaxy]].

His name originates from a different reading of Fudou Myouou (不動明王), the Japanese rendering of [[Acala]], a deity revered in esoteric Japanese Buddhism.

title: burnt_(off)
body:
[[Elsen (off)|]] who've succumb to emotional distress in the game [[OFF (game)|]].

Regular Burnt are headless, with a streak of smoke or blood extending beyond the screen of the game.

Valzong-burnt look identical to regular ones, but possess a symbol of four circles in a big circle around their necks. Their hands have turned black.

Calvary-burnt look identical to regular ones, but possess oversized black claw-like hands.

Critic-burnt look like Elsen whose heads became huge.

Pastel-burnt have lab coats, black reptilian-like heads and large black claw-like hands, with a normal Elsen head popping out of the reptilian one's mouth on occasion.

title: robot_girls_z
body:
[b]Robot Girls Z[/b] (ロボットガールズＺ [i]Robotto Gāruzu Zetto[/i]) is television anime series produced by Toei Animation. The series is a comedic parody of various 70s [[mecha]] series produced by Toei, anthropomorphizing robots from those series into magical girls. 

The title of the anime is a tribute to one of the first [[super robot]] shows ever produced, [[Mazinger Z]].

The series aired on the Toei Channel between January 4, 2014 and March 2, 2014 and was simulcast by Crunchyroll.

h4. Characters

h6. Team Z

* [[Z-chan]] - [[Mazinger Z]] (1972)
* [[Gre-chan]] - [[Great Mazinger]] (1974)
* [[Grenda-san]] - [[Grendizer]] - [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] (1975)

h6. Team G

* [[Gecchan]] - [[Getter Robo]] (1974)
* [[Jeeg-san]] - [[Koutetsu Jeeg]] (1975)

h6. Team T

* [[Gai-chan]] - [[Gaiking]] (1977)
* [[Bara-tan]] - [[Baratack]] - [[Choujin Sentai Baratack]] (1977)

h6. Underground Empire

* [[Garada K7]] - [[Mazinger Z]]

body:
A Japanese [[convenience store]] franchise chain.

FamilyMart is Japan's second-largest convenience store chain, behind [[7-Eleven]], and used to be the largest chain store in South Korea (now renamed to CU).

All of the usual Japanese convenience store goods such as basic grocery items, magazines, manga, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks like sake, nikuman, fried chicken, onigiri, and bento are available.

It first opened in Japan on September 1, 1981.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: FamilyMart":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FamilyMart

title: seven-segment_display
body:
A seven-segment display is a form of electronic display used to show decimal numerals, ususally using [[LED]] or LCD technology.

This is very commonly seen in [[digital clock]]s, [[calculator]]s and other simple electronic devices without more sophisticated high-resolution display panels.

See [[segment display]] for similar displays that have a different number of segments.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22643908

h4. See also

* [[Segment display]]
* [[Tag group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Seven-segment display":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seven-segment_display]

title: segment_display
body:
An electronic display that displays numbers or letters using a pattern of line segments that can be turned on or off.

The most common type has seven segments, but eight-, nine-, fourteen-, and sixteen-segment displays also exist.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22643908: [[Seven-segment display]]

h4. See also

* [[Seven-segment display]]
* [[Tag group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Seven-segment display":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seven-segment_display
* "Wikipedia: Nine-segment display":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nine-segment_display
* "Wikipedia: Fourteen-segment display":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fourteen-segment_display

title: shinganji_kurenai
body:
Shinganji Kurenai (心願寺 紅) is an independent Taimanin. Designed by [[Zol]]
She is the protagonist of [[Taimanin Kurenai]] together with her friend [[Makishima Ayame]].
Kurenai is successor of Shinganji Gen-an and would be the head of the Shinganji family of the Fuuma clan, but was outcast for her half-vampire blood and saving of Ayame.
She is the daughter of Edwin Black and [[Felicia (Taimanin Asagi)]]'s older sister.

title: comic_sans
body:
A font designed to resemble the hand-lettered text of classic comic books. It is infamous for its gross over-usage, especially in contexts and situations where a silly font would be inappropriate.

title: sengoku_collection
body:
A mobile social networking game created by [[Konami]], which was launched for the Mobage service in December 2010.

The series features female representations of feudal lords from the Sengoku period. An anime television series produced by Brain's Base based on the game aired on TV Tokyo between April 5, 2012 and September 27, 2012.

Game ended service on May 30, 2019.

title: testament_(guilty_gear)
body:
Free-willed Gear from [[Guilty Gear]] who was originally a human child and changed into the way they are today by the Post-War Administration Bureau.

In [i]Guilty Gear[/i], they plotted to revive [[Justice_(guilty_gear)|]]. In [[Guilty Gear X]], they dedicated themselves to protecting [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]]. They were adopted by [[Kliff Undersn]].

They fight using a [[scythe]] made of [[blood]] along with their unnatural Gear powers.

Testament is [[1other|non-binary]] according to their official bio as of [[Guilty Gear Strive]], with prior depictions leaning masculine.
 
They have [[succubus familiar]]s at their command.

h4. External links

* "Official Website: Testament":[https://www.guiltygear.com/ggst/en/character/tst/]
* "Guilty Gear Wiki: Testament":https://guiltygear.fandom.com/wiki/Testament

title: tanghulu
body:
A traditional Chinese snack of candied fruit. Tanghulu are often mistaken for regular candied fruits; however, they are coated in a hardened sugar syrup. This sweet and sour treat has been made since the Song Dynasty and remains popular throughout northern China.

The most common fruit used for tanghulu is [[shanzha_(fruit)|]], but you can also find other variants with [[strawberry]], [[mandarin orange]], [[kiwi_(fruit)|]], etc.

Not to be confused with [[candy apple]] or [[dango]].

title: german_flag
body:
The modern [[flag]] of [[Germany]], consisting of three horizontal bars colored black, red, and yellow.

It was used from 1919 to 1933 by the Weimar Republic, from 1949 to 1959 by both East and West Germany, from 1959 to 1990 only by West Germany, and from 1990 to the present by unified Germany.

Not to be confused for the [[Belgian flag]].

title: onisaki_kirara
body:
Kirara Onisaki (鬼崎 きらら), born Freya (フレイヤ), is an important recurring character in the online games. Designed by [[Aoi Nagisa (metalder)]]
She is a Taimanin and a senior student at Gosha Academy. Kirara is a half-demon, with her mother being a high ranking Kijin of Frost, and her father being part of the demon killing. Onisaki clan. Her original name was Onisaki Freya. Many people assume that the ice she can control is her Ninja Art, but this is not the case, the ice is part of her frost demon heritage, while she often hesitates to use her real Ninja Art.

title: moelotl
body:
An eastern-themed humanoid race evolved from axolotls, Moelotls appears to be humans with axolotl gills as ears and think, slimy tail they can detach painlessly as decoy for enemies. Physically weak and fragile, and has innate fear to mechanoids faction due to their history, these people perfected a cultivation method to utilize their inner Qi energy to perform devastating attacks and made weapons powered by said Qi in order to dispatch their enemies.  

Cultivating a Moelotl's Qi energy takes a long time, but the payoff are worth the while. Their ranged attacks can takes waves of enemy mechanoids in one hit!  

Link to steam workshop page: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3292351432

title: milira_(rimworld)

In battles they command mechanoids/gynoids called 'Milian' which uses naming scheme based on chess pieces, and uses large area-of-attack skills tied to their weapons.

Link to steam workshop page: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3256974620

title: moonflower_(flower)
body:
[i][b]Ipomoea alba[/b][/i], commonly called moonflower, is a species of [[flower]]ing plant of the genus [i]Ipomoea[/i] in the family [i]Convolvulaceae[/i].

As a species of [[morning glory]], it shares the same features. The flowers are funnel-shaped, but instead of blooming during the day, they bloom at night. The flowers are usually white, but sometimes pink.

Its common Japanese name, ヨルガオ (夜顔 [i]yoru-gao[/i]), literally translates to "night face".

h4. Examples
* !post #4777749
* !post #4801789

h4. See also

The game is based off the [[podracer|podracing]] scene in [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace|The Phantom Menace]], and features tracks on a variety of planets.

title: star_wars:_dark_empire
body: Dark Empire is a [[Star Wars]] comic book metaseries produced by Dark Horse Comics. It consists of a six-issue limited series written by Tom Veitch and drawn by Cam Kennedy, followed by a second six-issue limited series by Veitch and Kennedy, followed in turn by a two-issue limited series written by Veitch and drawn by Jim Baikie. The initial series is notable for being one of the first Star Wars comics to be produced by Dark Horse, which retained the comic rights to the franchise for over two decades.

title: joystick
body:
A device used to control a character in a videogame. Distinguished from the more generic [[game controller]] tag  by the presence of an obvious stick, e.g. a fightstick, a flightstick, a hand-stick as found on most arcade videogames, or analog thumbsticks as found on the controllers for home consoles such as [[Nintendo 64]], [[Playstation 2]]/[[Playstation 3]] or [[Xbox 360]].

A game controller for home console, without sticks as described above, would be a [[gamepad]].

Also used to control actual vehicles such as aircraft, but also occasionally used in pairs for armored land vehicles.

body: An opening in a planet's crust where magma, gases, and volcanic ash escape from below the surface. Typically depicted as a [[mountain]] with [[smoke]] or [[lava]] coming out from the top.

body:

Popularly enjoyed in Japan during the wintertime, especially while sitting underneath a [[kotatsu]].

title: oden
body:
A Japanese winter dish consisting of several ingredients such as [[hardboiled egg]]s, [[daikon]] radish, [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]], and processed [[fish cake]]s stewed in a light, soy-flavoured dashi broth.

While these are the core ingredients, oden is very much subject to regional and personal variations.

h4.  See also

* [[Nabe]]
* [[Sukiyaki]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: popcorn
body:
A popular snack food made by heating up maize kernels until it can no longer tolerate the pressure and pops, releasing its starches inside. From there, the popcorn can be seasoned or sweetened as desired. It is iconic with watching movies.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: chipmunk
body: Small, striped rodents of the family Sciuridae (the same as [[squirrel|squirrels]]). Chipmunks have an omnivorous diet primarily consisting of seeds, nuts and other fruits, and buds.

title: puffer_fish
body:
A species of [[fish]] that is known for inflating its body when it is threatened. Also known as a blowfish.

Most species of puffer fish are highly poisonous, but some are considered a delicacy and can be eaten when prepared properly.

h4. See also

* [[puffer fish vomiting water (meme)|]]

title: thai_flag
body:
The flag of the Kingdom of [[Thailand]] shows five horizontal stripes in the colors red, white, blue, white and red, with the central blue stripe being twice as wide as each of the other four. The colors are said to stand for nation-religion-king, an unofficial motto of Thailand, red for the land and people, white for religions and blue for the monarchy.

The design was adopted on 28 September 1917, according to the royal decree issued by Rama VI.

title: serbian_flag

title: smiling_friends
body:
Smiling Friends is an adult animated television series created by Zach Hadel and Michael Cusack for [[Cartoon network|Cartoon Network's]] night-time programming block [[Adult Swim]], which revolves around the surreal misadventures of a small company and its four employees dedicated to spreading happiness. The show utilizes a wide variety of different art styles and animation techniques. This includes but is not limited to stylized traditional animation, CGI, rotoscoping, stop motion, and live-action.

h4. Characters

title: philippine_flag

title: republic_of_china_flag
body:
The [b]Republic of China flag[/b], often called simply the Taiwanese flag, is the [[flag]] that has de facto represented [[Taiwan]] since the end of the [[Chinese Civil War]]. The design consists of a white sun in a blue canton on a red field. In Chinese, the flag is commonly called the [b]Blue Sky, White Sun, and a Wholly Red Earth[/b] flag.

Used by the [[Kuomintang]] party since 1917. The official flag of the Republic of China since 1928. Since 1949, mostly used in Taiwan, where the Republic of China has continued to exist.

Not to be confused with the [[people's_republic_of_china_flag|People's Republic of China flag]] (the flag of Mainland China, widely known simply as the [i]Chinese flag[/i]).

* !asset #20124411

h4. See also

* [[Five-colored flag]] (historical)
* [[Hong Kong regional flag]]
** [[Black Bauhinia flag]]
* [[People's Republic of China flag]] (a.k.a. Chinese flag)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flag of the Republic of China":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Republic_of_China 
* "Wikipedia: List of Chinese flags":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_flags

title: people's_republic_of_china_flag
body:
The [b]People's Republic of China flag[/b], the Five Star Red Flag, often called simply the "Chinese flag" is the flag that has [i]de facto[/i] represented Mainland China since the end of the Chinese Civil War. The design consists of a group of golden stars on a red background.

* !asset #20077398

Designed, developed and officially introduced in 1949. The red field is officially meant to symbolize [[communism]], the big yellow star the Communist Party, and the four smaller stars meant the farmers, workers, intellectuals, and the bourgeoisie. Some people interpret the stars to be meant the five major ethnic groups of China, with the Han Chinese getting the large star and the four other stars meant to be Manchurians, Mongolians, Tibetans, and Uyghurs.

Not to be confused with the [[republic_of_china_flag|Republic of China flag]] (a.k.a. Taiwanese flag). 

h4. See also

* [[Five-colored flag]]
* [[Hong Kong regional flag]]
* [[Republic of China flag]] (a.k.a. Taiwanese flag)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flag of the People's Republic of China":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China
* "Wikipedia: List of Chinese flags":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_flags

title: wangzhe_rongyao
body:
Simplified Chinese: 王者荣耀 (Wangzhe Rongyao)
Subtitle: Glory of the king
Unofficial English title: King of Glory
Official English title: Honor of Kings

A Chinese mobile MOBA game, published by Tencent Games for Android and iOS, largely inspired by [[League of Legends]]. Although unknown in most of the world, it is one of the most played and most profitable video games of all time with hundreds of millions of players. Prior to being released globally in 2022, it received an international adaptation in 2016, known as [[Arena of Valor]], with altered designs to accommodate the Western market.

title: remora
body: A ray-finned fish of any species in the family [i]Echeneidae[/i], which have dorsal fins adapted into a suction device. Using this device, they attach themselves to larger marine animals with which they form symbiotic relationships, removing parasites in return for protection and transport. In popular culture, remoras are best-known for attaching themselves to sharks (hence the common name "sharksucker"), though they have been known to attach themselves to turtles, whales, and even human divers.

body:

The former flag which was adopted from 1918 to 1921 (and from 1991 to 2004) consists of a dark red field with black and white bands in the canton.

When a character or object is breaking into [[shards]] or something else solid, such as [[butterfly|butterflies]], [[petals]], et cetera. Be sure to include [[distortion]] or [[body horror]] when applicable.

* !post #6879054
* !post #4296893

*  If a character is secreting an object or abnormal fluid, such as bleeding out flower petals, use [[alternate body fluid]].

* Use [[dissolving]] instead if a character is becoming incorporated into a [[liquid]] or [[smoke]].

* Use [[melting]] instead if a character or object is [[dripping]].

title: matsuda_seiko
body:
Matsuda Seiko is a renowned Japanese pop singer and actress, often referred to as the "Eternal Idol." 
She gained immense popularity in the 1980s and has been a significant influence in Japanese pop culture. With her charming voice and numerous hit songs, she continues to be an iconic figure in the Japanese entertainment industry.

title: cockroach
body:
Common insect pest, often [[censored]] for comic effect. In Japan, the word for them is "gokiburi", sometimes shortened to G -- especially by terrified girls who don't even want to speak their name.

Contrary to popular belief it is not poisonous and thus easy to handle manually.

title: avocado
body:
A vegetable native to [[Mexico]] with a green-skinned, fleshy body that may be pear-shaped, egg-shaped, or spherical. Its skin is pitch black or green.

While technically a fruit, it is often served with salty foods like meat, [[taco]]s and [[torta]]s.

Main ingredient of [[guacamole]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: professor_layton
body:
A puzzle-adventure series exclusively released on [[Nintendo DS]] and [[nintendo_3ds|3DS]]. The series revolves around an Archeologist named [[Hershel Layton]], a gentleman and lover of all things puzzle. The games are designed by [[Level-5]] and feature brain-teaser puzzles that range from simplistic to downright maddening.

There are presently six games released so far. The first three games are referred to as "episodes" 4, 5, and 6, while the fourth through sixth games are part of a prequel trilogy. Starting with the seventh, the series moves forward in time.

h4. Games
* [i]Professor Layton and the Curious Village[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the Diabolical Box[/i]
* [i][[Professor Layton and the Unwound Future]][/i] (EU: [i]Professor Layton and the Lost Future[/i])
* [i]Professor Layton and the Specter's Flute[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the Miracle Mask[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the Azran Legacy[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the New World of Steam[/i]

h4. Films

h4. Spinoffs

title: poop_emoji
body:
The infamous "pile of poo" [[emoji]] (💩).

Typically rendered as a brown, coil-shaped pile of feces with big eyes and a friendly smile. It enjoys a wide range of idiosyncratic usage, typically silly or whimsical.

Its existence owes to Japanese toilet humor, as an holdover from earlier proto-emoji systems.

title: gwenpool
body:
A [[Marvel]] comics character, first appeared as an amalgam of [[Gwen Stacy]] and [[Deadpool]] created by Chris Bachalo for a variant cover of Deadpool's Secret Secret Wars #2, which was one of twenty such variant covers published due to the popularity of [[Spider-Gwen]] from June 2015. Marvel later created her as a fully-fledged character because of the popularity of the design. Her real name is [b]Gwendolyn "Gwen" Poole[/b]. She has other codenames such as [b]Pink Slayer[/b].

An unemployed 18-year-old high school dropout and a comics fan who was transported to the Marvel Universe from the real world, Gwen has vast meta-knowledge about the Marvel Universe and can break the fourth wall to interact with readers. [spoilers]She even has the ability of reality manipulation which she later used to retcon herself as a mutant[/spoilers].

Unlike [[Spider-Gwen]], she's not a variant of [[Gwen Stacy]] or [[Deadpool]].

title: aak_(arknights)
body:
[i]Aak, Specialist Operator of Rhodes Island, will support other Operators from the rear.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Lungmen[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 25[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A medical personnel from [[Lee (Arknights)|]]'s Detective Agency, he was a well-known underground doctor operating in the gray zones of Lungmen. After joining, he proved to be a tremendous wellspring of medical knowledge and theory with the clinical experience to back it up, though his style of practice is rather worrying. However, based upon [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|Kal'tsit's]] comprehensive evaluation, he was recommended on a provisional basis to the medical equipment department and technological development team.

Does not get along well with Rhodes Island operators, with notable exceptions such as [[Hung (Arknights)|]] and [[Waai Fu (Arknights)|]], who are his agency colleagues, and [[Warfarin (Arknights)|]], who regularly gets into discussions with her regarding medicine.

Infamous among the player base for dealing massive friendly fire damage in exchange for immense power boosts.

His motif is based on the [[komainu]]. His [[voice actor]] is [[Sanpei Yuuko]].

h4. Skins

* !post #3851626: Elite ii.

title: narugino_mikatan
body: A female character from the series [[Punch Line]]. She has [[green_eyes|green]] to [[blue_eyes|blue]] colored eyes, thick eyelashes, and [[pink hair]] decorated with bells.  Publicly she is a member of an idol group, but behind the scenes she dons on a costume and is a superhero named [[Strange Juice]] who has an orange (fruit) themed outfit and fights with an over-sized [[drinking straw]].  She possesses the ability to power-up her physical abilities, which causes her hair to change to a glowing orange color and her eyes to glow with a flowery [[+_+|+]] shape appearing over them.

title: iridatsu_yuuta
body: The protagonist of the anime series [[Punch Line]]. Upon seeing women's underwear he gets excited and gains superhuman abilities, but seeing women's underwear again while in this state causes him to overload and faint.  After a bus hijacking incident, an unknown spirit also steals possession of his body and forces him to be a roaming spirit. He's now stuck trying to figure out how to return to his body.

title: chiyoko_(punch_line)
body:
A young girl with dark hair from the series [[Punch Line]].  She has thick eyelashes, a small amount of hair tied on the left side of hair, and two short tufts of hair that stick out on the right side of her hair.

The boy Pine, the girl Guriko, and Chiyoko were three kids who grew up together.

title: frederica_rosenfort
body:
A young female character from the series [[86 -Eightysix-]].  She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[red eyes]].

Frederica is the adopted daughter of Ernst Zimmerman, the Federal Republic of Giad's temporary President. She serves as the "mascot" of the Nordlicht Squadron.
other_names: フレデリカ・ローゼンフォルト

title: shourei_nouzen
body:
A male character from the series [[86 -Eightysix-]].  He is the older brother to the protagonist [[Shinei Nouzen]].  He has [[red hair]] and [[black eyes]], the opposite of his younger brother.  He also wears a pair of [[glasses]].

Nicknamed Rei, Shourei is an 86er who served before his younger brother.  His Personal Name, a name granted to veteran 86ers as their permanent call sign, is Dullahan. This matched his personal emblem for the mecha he pilots, a [[m1a4 juggernaut|Juggernaut]], which was a headless skeleton holding a sword.
other_names: ショーレイ・ノウゼン

title: grete_(spy_kyoushitsu)
body:
[quote][i]I’m code name Daughter Dearest—now, let's fill this time with laughter and tears.[/i][/quote]

Grete is a female character from the series [[spy_kyoushitsu|Spy Classroom]].  She is 18-years-old with [[short_hair|short]] length [[red hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. 

She is depicted as rather reserved, though possesses a very tactical mind.  Her code name is "[i]Daughter Dearest[/i]" (愛娘 [i]manamusume[/i], "[i]beloved daughter"[/i]) and her specialty is disguises. She is member 5 of team Lamplight.

title: daihatsu_midget
body:
A [[three-wheeler|three-wheeled]] rickshaw mini-truck produced by [[Daihatsu]] from 1957 to 1972.

Known as the basis of the [[Tuk-tuk]] taxis in several countries.

h4. See also
* [[Daihatsu Midget II]]

title: object_(vehicle)
body:
Objects are (generally) large mostly spherical war machines featured in the series [[Heavy Object]].

They have heights around 50 meters (164 feet) tall and weigh around 100k metric tons (110k short tons). They're armed with a large quantity and variety weapons for fighting infantry, vehicles, and other objects.  Objects are also heavily armored, easily being able to shrug off all but the heaviest of weapons.  Due to this, it is generally accepted that the only way to defeat an object is by fighting against it with another object.

h4. List of Objects

* [[Baby Magnum]], piloted by [[Milinda Brantini]].
* [[Gatling 033]], piloted by [[Ohoho_(heavy object)|]].

title: daihatsu_midget_ii
body: A four-wheeled kei truck produced by [[Daihatsu]]. It was a revamped version of the original [[Daihatsu Midget]], and were produced from 1996 to 2001.

title: ohoho_(heavy_object)
body: A female character from the series [[Heavy Object]]. She is a [[object_(vehicle)|object]] elite (pilot) for the Intelligence Union.  Her real name hasn't been revealed, so the main character gave her a nickname based on her laugh. She is also referred to by the nickname "G Cup" for her listed bust size.
other_names: おほほ(ヘヴィーオブジェクト)

title: aya_drevis
body:
The main protagonist and the player character of [[Mad Father]]. She is the only child of [[monika_drevis|Monika]] and [[Alfred Drevis]].

Aya is 11 years old. She has long, black hair with [[blunt bangs]]. Her normal outfit consists of a blue, [[puffy_sleeves|puff sleeved]] ankle-length dress, with a white [[apron]] worn over it, and tied in a bow at the back. As accessories she wears a [[necklace]] with a gold pendant, and a big pink [[hair_bow|bow]] on the back of her head.

title: double-decker_bus
body:
A [[bus]] with two floors, one on top and one on bottom.

It's commonly associated with [[London]], but some are seen all over the world.

title: traffic_jam
body: When [[traffic]] is crowding a road to the point of restricting freedom of movement.

body:
The main protagonist and player character of [[Misao]].

Aki is shown to have brown hair tied up into [[twintails]], tied up by two pink [[hair_bow|hair bows]]. Is often associated with a [[baseball bat]].

body:
A [[Shadow (shadows_house)|]], and one of the main protagonists of [[Shadows House]], alongside her "face" [[Emilico (shadows house)|]]. Voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

Has [[long hair]] with [[two side up]]. Wears a [[red dress]] with [[long sleeves]] and a pair of [[red rose|red roses]] [[hair flower|on her hair]]. Like all Shadows, she has [[black skin]] and [[black hair|hair]].

title: battle_rifle
body:
A [[gun|firearm]] that uses full-power [[rifle cartridge|ammunition]] (e.g. 7.62×51mm NATO), capable of fully-automatic fire or selective fire, and uses removable magazines. They were the connecting link between semi-automatic rifles (SVT-40, Gewehr 43) and [[assault rifle]]s. 

Though battle rifles were highly supplanted in mainstream service by lighter assault rifles, many are still used in specialist roles (e.g. designated marksman) by many [[military|armed forces]] and police units.

h4. List of battle rifles

* [[AR-10]]
* [[ASh-12.7]]
* [[Beretta BM 59]]

title: sniper_rifle
body:
A high-precision [[rifle]] designed to accurately engage targets at long range, equipped with a [[scope|telescopic sight]] most of the time. Most modern sniper rifles feature a buttstock with adjustable length and cheekpiece position, as well as a (detachable) [[bipod]] for stability. Some of them fire specialized [[rifle cartridge|rounds]] such as the .338 Lapua Magnum, while many models share the same ammunition with the more common service rifles, such as 7.62×51mm NATO.

This tag also apply to World War II-era or earlier conventional full-length rifles with a long range scope, such as the [[Mosin-Nagant]].

title: ase_kaichatta_ne_cesario_(vocaloid)
body:
[i]EN: You worked up quite the sweat there, [[Cesario (racehorse)|]].[/i]

Infamous [[Vocaloid]] song singing about making onigiri with sweat from Cesario the racehorse. Sung using [[Hatsune Miku]]'s voicebank.

The song was quite the meme during the old [[2channel|2ch]] and [[Niconico]] days, though it recently made a comeback because of the horse's [[Cesario (Umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]] being announced, leading her to be strongly associated with onigiri, making them while sweating or just refering to the song while she's sweating or when eating an onigiri she has made.

h4. Lyrics

h6. Original JP

[quote]
9月だというのに
たくさん汗をかいた シーザリオ
またがっていた（またがっていた！）
僕の手にはびっしょりシーザリオの汗
両手を広げて吹かれる 時間を忘れた
手にできた結晶を
僕はおひつを開けて おにぎりを握った
おいしいね シーザリオ
[/quote]

h6. EN translation

[quote]
[i]Even though it's September
You worked up quite the sweat there, Cesario[/i]

[i]I sat astride you (astride you!)
With my hands drenched in Cesario's sweat[/i]

[i]I spread my hands with the wind blowing and forgot the time
The crystals I've got on my hands
I opened the rice container and made a rice ball
It sure is delicious, Cesario[/i]
[/quote]

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Original song":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3HIHDjYZOAc]

title: taiwan
body:
A country located on the titular island of Taiwan in East Asia. As a country, it was established by [[Chiang Kai-Shek]] and various [[Kuomintang]]-affiliated Chinese after the Republic of China was [[Chinese civil war|defeated]] by [[Mao Zedong]]'s [[china|Communist China]] and evacuated to the island. The state still serving as the continuity of the Republic of China and still using the same official name of "Republic of China" as when the state ruled mainland China.

The political status of Taiwan is complex, with the People's Republic of China claiming sovereignty over the island under the One-China Policy and refusing diplomatic relations with any country that officially recognizes Taiwan. Taiwan itself, meanwhile, is politically divided between the current ruling "Pan-Green Coalition" lead by the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), which seeks to relinquish the claim on mainland China and officially become an independent country as Taiwan, and the "Pan-Blue Coalition" lead by the Kuomintang Party, which maintains its claim as the sole and legitimate government of the entirety of China.

This tag can be applied if the post features the [[Republic of China flag]], or features [[real world location]]s in Taiwan. Do not tag [[China]] on Taiwan-related posts unless that post also features the PRC's flag or locations, as well as a reference to the [[Chinese civil war]].

h4. See also

* [[China]] (People's Republic of China)
* [[Kuomintang]] - for posts about pre-1987 Republic of China
* [[Republic of China flag]] - flag of modern Taiwan and its mainland precursor.
* [[Taipei 101]]

title: streetwear
body:
A style of trendy urban fashion, primarily based around comfortable yet stylish clothes, usually mixing athletic or casual wear with expensive brands and pieces.

Streetwear takes influence from several musical genres and urban subcultures, including [[hip hop]], [[surfing]], [[skateboarding]], and [[punk]]. Several designer brands have also found popularity in streetwear communities due their prevalence in rap music, most notably [[Gucci]], [[Balenciaga]], [[Louis Vuitton (brand)|]] and [[Supreme (brand)|]].

Fans of streetwear and its most popular brands are sometimes referred to as "Hypebeasts":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/hypebeast].

title: mod_fashion
body:
An "unconventionally modern" style of dress originating in England in the 1960s. Mod clothes leaned toward ultra-short and [[sleeveless]], and usually had bright colors and patterns. Popular styles were [[miniskirt]]s, jumpers, shift dresses, patent rain trenches, patent leather go-go boots, and [[pantyhose]]. A popular outfit was coordinating a ribbed knit [[turtleneck]] with a miniskirt with matching tights with [[knee boots]].

title: sakurai_momoka
body:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. She appeared in the Idolm@ster Cinderella Girls anime.

Momoka is a very elegant young 12 y.o. lady with a princess-like disposition, who acts very mature for her age. Her clothes tend to be very frilly and covered in flower motifs. She's from a wealthy upbringing.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Momoka is a mature girl who appears to have a lady-like aura about her. While she often tries to act older than she is, Momoka still is a young girl at heart and is susceptible to things girls her age enjoy. She was scouted by considering herself the prize in the Production Match Festival. She regularly holds tea parties with the younger idols, and takes them very seriously. Her favorite tea seems to be “Rose Hip Tea”, although she can occasionally be distracted from it via the antics of her guests.

Momoka found a friend in [[Umeki Otoha]], as they both shared a similar demeanor. She appears to enjoy teasing [[Kamiya Nao]], as she notes Nao chooses her clothes and costumes with the Producer in mind. Momoka also really likes the glasses [[Kamijo Haruna]] gave her, and enjoys selecting kimonos with friends. She holds the Producer in very high regard and shows that she will put herself on the line in order to show him that she cares about him.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Shiomi Syuko]].

Voiced by [[Terui Haruka]].

title: tupet
body: A juice drink contained inside a tube made from plastic. It's 'tu', not 'chu' or 'chew' because the name of the product is derived from the word チューブ (chuubu) - tube. Can also be frozen in the freezer and eaten as a frozen treat or a [[popsicle]]. In that case, the center of the container has been made smaller so it can be broken in half. This drink has a lot of similar products and other brand names. Tupet is the best known one (but not the first one). The other names include "Bou-juice (Stick-juice)" by Satou Seika, "[[Chu Chu Ice]]" by Alps Seika, "Pokkin Ice", "Pakkin Ice" and so on. Similar products outside of Japan include the Colombian "Bon-Ice". The manufacturer of tupets, MAEDA SANGYO Co.ltd, issued a voluntary recall of this product in 2009, saying, "We understand that there has been some concern for an outbreak of mold caused by a flaw in the manufacturing process." After that, the company stated that "In the end, we have identified that resolving this problem by improving our facilities/machines would cost too much time and money." and decided to discontinue the product. This drink has more than 30 years of history and many fans. The news of the discontinuation caused great sorrow among them. However, actually nobody was troubled because some similar products are still sold. h4. Variations in other countries United States: Freeze pop, Freezer pop, Icee; Otter Pops ©, Fla-Vor-Ice ©, Pop-Ice © United Kingdom: Ice pole, Ice pop; Mr. Freeze © Australia: Zooper Dooper © Philippines: Ice candy Spain: Polo Flash India: Sip Up h4. See also * [[Tag group:Food tags]] h4. External links * "Wikipedia (JP): チューペット":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/チューペット] * "Q&A site 'Oshiete goo': What do you call this popsicle? (JP)":http://oshiete.goo.ne.jp/qa/1615363.html

title: light_machine_gun
body:
A type of [[machine gun]] designed to be operated by a single person, with or without an assistant.

Early LMG designs were typically [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]-fed and they fire full-powered [[rifle cartridge]], such as the .303 British [[Bren lmg|Bren]]. Modern post-[[World War II]] designs fire intermediate [[ammunition|round]], and they can be either [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] or magazine-fed (e.g. the 5.56×45mm NATO [[M249 saw]]). They are also known as the [i]squad automatic weapon[/i].

Some LMGs are based on the existing service [[assault rifle|(assault) rifle]], such as the [[RPK]].

title: oiran
body:
A traditional Japanese courtesan in Edo (present-day Tokyo), the [i]Yoshiwara[/i]. They were a much higher-class subtype of [[yuujo]], the iconic feudal-era Japanese [[prostitution|prostitutes]]. 

Unlike [[yuujo]], oiran were more educated and cultured, and had talents beyond those used in the bedroom. This gave them a social standing which put them well above any common prostitute, even outside the red-light districts. The companionship of an oiran did not come cheaply, so their clientele were primarily men of high political or social ranking. 

Oiran should not be confused with [[geisha]], who tend to dress far less luxuriously and who do not provide any sexual services. After World War II, the geisha eventually ended up replacing the role of "classic, respectable female entertainer" that oiran had filled in Japanese society.

h4. See also

title: mizuno_ai
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character.

She was the leader of the idol group Iron Frill, which [[Minamoto Sakura]] was a fan of in life. However, like Sakura, she too died in 2008, [spoiler]with her cause of death being a freak lightning hitting her at a concert,[/spoiler] and eventually being revived by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]] as a [[zombie]] alongside Sakura.

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with multiple flowery [[hair ornament]] decorating it, and [[red eyes]]. Due to how she died, without her makeup she is wrapped in [[bandages]].

Voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]

title: nikaidou_saki
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character. Saki was the special attack unit captain of Dorami, a bosozoku gang during the 1990s led by [[Kirishima Reiko (zombie land saga)|]]. She died in 1997 after [spoiler]she drove off a ledge in a game of chicken[/spoiler]. She later became revived as a [[zombie]] by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[orange hair|orange]] and [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], with the streaks likely being hair dye, given how Reiko had similar streaks when she was in Dorami but currently does not. Saki wears a [[letterman jacket]] and [[long skirt]].

She was a big fan of [[tamagotchi]] and [[drive-in tori]] when she was alive, and was thrilled when it was revealed she (and Franchouchou) was going to be featured in the latter's commercial.

Voiced by [[Tano Asami]].

title: minamoto_sakura
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character. A 17-year-old who was killed after being hit by a mini truck in 2008.

Ten years later, she was resurrected as a [[zombie]] by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]]. Koutarou offered her to become the founding member of Koutarou's zombie idol group [i]Franchouchou[/i] and help him promote the Saga prefecture. Sakura accepted the deal with Koutarou to pursue her dream when she was alive: to became a great idol.

She has dark [[pink hair]] or [[red hair]] with a small [[one side up]] tied with a pink and green polka dot [[ribbon]] on the left side of her head. In her zombie form, she has a large [[scar]] on her forehead. Her original (human) eye color is [[blue_eyes|blue]], but it turned into [[red_eyes|red]] in her zombie form. She has [[medium breasts]] and is occasionally depicted as having [[large breasts]] in fanart.

Voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]].

title: zombie_land_saga
body:
2018 original anime, produced by [[Studio MAPPA]].

A series about a group of 7 deceased girls from various time periods in the past who were resurrected as [[zombie]] [[idol|idols]] with the task of saving [[Saga Prefecture]], Japan as the idol group [i]Franchouchou[/i].

h4. Characters

* [[Tatsumi Koutarou]]
* [[Minamoto Sakura]]
* [[Nikaidou Saki]]
* [[Mizuno Ai]]
* [[Konno Junko]]
* [[Yuugiri_(Zombie_Land_Saga)|]]
* [[Hoshikawa Lily]]
* [[Yamada Tae]]
* Male Cop A (Keisatsukan A)
* [[Romero_(zombie land saga)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Drive-in Tori]]
* [[Adabana Necromancy]]

h4. External links

title: lo_the_prayers_of_the_voiceless_voice
body:
A Fairy-Type [[Duel Monster]] who first appeared in the Ritual Spell Card Novox's Prayer, praying for the arrival of [[Skull Guardian]]. She has [[blue hair]] and she wears a [[red robe]].

Notorious for having the lowest non-0 ATK stat in [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]: 50. As such, she's treated as a joke by a few artists. In particular, [[Sawan Cutman]] draws fan art of her getting the butt monkey treatment.

He's reincarnation of [[Isaac Newton]], an English physicist and mathematician who found the concept of gravity. His talent is "Fruit of Gravity".

title: elle_vianno
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]Elle Vianno[/b] is an energetic, [[blonde hair]]ed girl with a [[ponytail]] who is a member of [[Judau Ashta]]'s original gang of [[machinery]] scavengers. She later becomes part of the [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i], where she pilots the [[Gundam Mk II]] and its [[Super Gundam]] variant.

body: [b]Miguel Gregorio Antonio Ignacio Hidalgo-Costilla y Gallaga Mandarte Villaseñor[/b] (8 May 1753 – 30 July 1811), more commonly known as [b]Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla[/b] or simply [b]Miguel Hidalgo[/b], was a [[mexico|Mexican]] [[priest]] and one of the first and most important leaders of the Mexican War of Independence (1810–1821).
